modules.description: This module defines and manipulates plotting styles for visualizing data points and shapes in Gnuplot. It supports operations to set point types, sizes, colors, and circle-based markers with configurable fill and radius. Concrete use cases include customizing scatter plots with colored points or annotated plots using circular markers.

Defines and manipulates colors for plot elements using RGB components. Provides constants for common colors and a function to create custom colors from red, green, and blue values. Used to set the color of lines, markers, and other visual components in plots.

This module creates 2D histograms from one-dimensional data points. It supports customizing appearance with color, bin count, bin width, and legend. Use it to visualize distributions of numerical data sets with precise control over histogram parameters.

This module creates 2D and 3D line plots from sequences of coordinates, with optional styling, legends, point markers, and error bars. It operates on data types representing 1D, 2D, and 3D real-valued points, and constructs plot specifications consumable by the Gnuplot interface. Concrete use cases include visualizing time series data in 2D, plotting trajectories in 3D space, and displaying measurement errors alongside data points.

This module defines and manipulates fill styles for shapes in Gnuplot plots. It supports operations to set fill styles to empty, solid with specified density and transparency, or patterned with a Gnuplot pattern code and transparency flag, and allows setting the fill color. It works with a private type `t` representing fill styles and `Plot.Color.t` for color values. Use this module to customize the appearance of filled areas in plots, such as bar charts or shaded regions, with control over color, pattern, and transparency.

Draws bar charts from labeled numerical data, supporting customizable fill styles, bar width, and optional legend labels. Works with tuples of string-annotated floats as input data. Useful for visualizing categorical data distributions or comparative metrics in reports.

This module configures axis tic marks for plots, controlling properties like visibility, positioning, and orientation. It operates on a `t` type representing tic settings, with functions to adjust border display, mirroring, rotation, log scaling, and tic intervals. Concrete use cases include setting rotated x-axis labels, enabling mirrored y-axis tics, or defining custom tic spacing for logarithmic plots.

Implements 2D and 3D circle plotting from point data with configurable radius and fill. Operates on tuples of coordinates and radii in 2D (x, y, r) and 3D (x, y, z, r). Directly supports visualizing spatial data with circular markers scaled relative to the x-axis.

This module defines a range with optional minimum and maximum float values, used to specify axis limits in plots. It provides functions to create a default range and construct custom ranges with specified bounds. Concrete use cases include setting x-axis or y-axis limits in a Gnuplot plot to focus on a particular data region.

This module creates 2D and 3D scatter plots from point data in `Plot.r2` and `Plot.r3` formats. It supports customizable styles for point appearance and optional legend labels. Use it to visualize datasets with coordinates in two or three dimensions, such as plotting experimental results or spatial data points.

Handles dataset creation from sequences, arrays, or lists, converting these structures into a specialized format for plotting. Works with generic data types `'dim` that represent point dimensions. Used to prepare numerical data for visualization by mapping OCaml collections into a structure compatible with Gnuplot.

This module defines a set of point type values used to specify marker styles in plots. It includes constants for common shapes like dots, squares, circles, and stars, as well as specialized markers such as delta and disk. These values are directly used when configuring plot series to control the visual representation of data points in Gnuplot output.

This module provides a complete interface to Gnuplot, enabling the creation and customization of 2D and 3D visualizations through a suite of submodules that handle styling, data transformation, and plot configuration. Core data types include points in 1D, 2D, and 3D space, ranges for axis limits, and styling constructs for colors, fill patterns, and markers. Operations span from constructing scatter plots and histograms to configuring axis tics and legends, with direct support for labeled bar charts, error bars, and spatial data visualization using circles and lines. Specific workflows include plotting time series with custom marker styles, visualizing distributions with colored histograms, and configuring logarithmic axes with precise tic intervals.
